com.ibm.team.build.common.model

Interface IBuildScheduleEntry


  • public interface IBuildScheduleEntry
    A build schedule entry. The entry is either interval-based or time-based. Interval-based entries specify an interval in minutes, for example 20. This would schedule a build to run every 20 minutes. Time-based schedules specify a specific hour and minute at which to start the build. If the schedule has a valid interval (interval > 0), then the time-based values (hour and minute) are ignored.
    Since:
    0.8

    • Method Detail

      • getBuildInterval

        int getBuildInterval()
        Get the build interval. An interval > 0 is considered valid. An interval < 1 should be ignored.
        Returns:
        the build interval in minutes

      • setBuildInterval

        void setBuildInterval(int minutes)
        Set the build interval. The build will be scheduled every minutes minutes. The minimum valid value is 1 minute. Any value less than 1 means the build will not be scheduled on an interval. If a valid interval is provided, hour and minute are ignored.
        Parameters:
        minutes -

      • getBuildHour

        int getBuildHour()
        Get the hour of the day (0-23) at which to start the build. Applies to time-based schedules only.
        Returns:
        the hour at which to start the build

      • setBuildHour

        void setBuildHour(int hour)
        Set the hour of the day (0-23) at which to start the build. Applies to time-based schedules only.
        Parameters:
        hour - hour at which to start the build
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given hour is not between 0-23.

      • getBuildMinute

        int getBuildMinute()
        Get the minute (0-59) at which to start the build. Applies to time-based schedules only.
        Returns:
        the minute at which to start the build

      • setBuildMinute

        void setBuildMinute(int minute)
        Set the minute (0-59) at which to start the build. Applies to time-based schedules only.
        Parameters:
        minute - hour at which to start the build
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given minute is not between 0-59.

      • getBuildScheduleProperties

        java.util.List getBuildScheduleProperties()
        Get the build schedule properties. These properties are valid only if the definition contains the configuration element for IScheduleConfigurationElement#ELEMENT_ID.
        Returns:
        A list whose elements are of type IBuildProperty.
        Since:
        0.9.5
